message.content:
cs.SY, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.GT. 

The paper deals with a theory of linearly solvable control, which involves decision-making in the presence of uncertainty. This is a broad area of research that spans several sub-disciplines of computer science. The paper specifically focuses on Markov Decision Processes (MDPs) and Path-Integral Control Problems, which are commonly studied in the fields of control theory and reinforcement learning. Therefore, cs.SY (Systems and Control) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also introduces a new framework for formulating control problems using Renyi divergences, which are a generalization of the KL divergence used in traditional MDPs. This involves concepts from information theory and machine learning, which suggests that cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) are also likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the properties of the resulting control laws, which involves concepts from information theory and optimization, suggesting that cs.IT (Information Theory) is a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper presents an alternative interpretation of the results as a 2-player Markov Game, which involves concepts from game theory, suggesting that cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory) is also a possible sub-category.
